intro: Egassea laurentii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 cm. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its ability to produce multiple blooms throughout the year.
